intro: Eriophyllum minus, commonly known as the narrowleaf woollypod, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Eriophyllum minus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
